body_html: I think we use from six.moves import xrange elsewhere in the codebase to handle this incompatibility, without the potential for a performance regression on Python 2.7. Any file that uses xrange() should have this import at the top.
body_text: I think we use from six.moves import xrange elsewhere in the codebase to handle this incompatibility, without the potential for a performance regression on Python 2.7. Any file that uses xrange() should have this import at the top.
body: I think we use `from six.moves import xrange` elsewhere in the codebase to handle this incompatibility, without the potential for a performance regression on Python 2.7. Any file that uses `xrange()` should have this import at the top.
